data.title: 以 1 到 3 分钟谈论以下主题
data.content: What are some negative consequences of being too popular? Why do you think that people want to be famous? Is it more important to be kind or to be popular? Explain the reasons for your choice.
data.answer: Over the past decades, pursuing popularity has always been one of the ultimate goals in many people’s life. Not only because they want to leave an impressive imprint on the world’s history, but also because fame can bring them a good fortune. Nevertheless, there are, without a doubt, several adverse effects of being too popular. First and foremost, too much popularity can potentially interfere with the celebrity’s personal life. We can cite a convincing example of China’s celebrities; they have to wear sunglasses, hats, and masks to avoid being recognized by their fans in the streets or other public areas when there are no pre-scheduled events require the public’s attention. Most influencers have to use bodyguards and other anti-detection measures to avoid unwanted exposure to their privacy, which makes it rather inconvenient for them to live a normal life. Apart from that, all celebrities must be extremely wary of their words and behaviors because they have a vast number of followers who look up to them. As a result, they cannot do whatever they want but to act as the exact persons that their fans expect them to be. In a word, to gain extensive popularity, celebrities have to give up something in one form or another.（217 字）
